text: The 2019 Liga 1 Putri season was the inaugural season of Liga 1 Putri, the top-flight Indonesian league for women's association football. The season started on 5 October 2019 and finished with two-legged finals on 22 and 28 December 2019. Persib Putri won the title after defeating TIRA-Persikabo Kartini 6–1 on aggregate. == Teams == Ten teams competed in the league. From the 18 current men's Liga 1 teams, eight didn't field a women's team. Note: Flags indicate national team as has been defined under FIFA eligibility rules. Players and coaches may hold more than one non-FIFA nationality. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Team ! Head Coach ! Captain |- | class="nowrap"| Arema Putri | class="nowrap"| Alief Syahrizal | class="nowrap"| Serli Anggraini |- | class="nowrap"| Bali United Women | class="nowrap"| Sandhika Pratama | class="nowrap"| I Dewa Ayu Ratna Sari |- | class="nowrap"| Galanita Persipura | class="nowrap"| Samuel Weya | class="nowrap"| Regina Wondo |- | class="nowrap"| Persebaya Putri | class="nowrap"| Ridwan Anwar | class="nowrap"| Lilla Puspita |- | class="nowrap"| Persib Putri | class="nowrap"| Iwan Bastian | class="nowrap"| Een Sumarni |- | class="nowrap"| Persija Putri | class="nowrap"| John Arwandhi | class="nowrap"| Viny Silfianus |- | class="nowrap"| PSIS Putri | class="nowrap"| Satrio Pratomo | class="nowrap"| Hartati |- | class="nowrap"| PSM Putri | class="nowrap"| Yusrifar Fajar | class="nowrap"| Daeng Rosma |- | class="nowrap"| PSS Putri | class="nowrap"| Yuyud Pujiarto | class="nowrap"| Suciana Yuliani |- | class="nowrap"| TIRA-Persikabo Kartini | class="nowrap"| Adi Kuswanto | class="nowrap"| Risda Yulianti |} ==Schedule and venue== The schedule of the competition was as follows: {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- ! Stage ! Round ! colspan="2"| Match date ! Group A venue ! Group B venue |- | rowspan="4"| Group stage | Series 1 | colspan="2"| 5–12 October 2019 | Maguwoharjo, Sleman | Kusuma Agrowisata, Batu |- | Series 2 | colspan="2"| 19–31 October 2019 | rowspan="2"| Pakansari, Cibinong | Gelora Samudra, Kuta |- | Series 3 | colspan="2"| 2–10 November 2019 | Cendrawasih, Biak Numfor |- | Series 4 | colspan="2"| 16–22 November 2019 | Wibawa Mukti, Cikarang | Gajayana, Malang |- | rowspan="2"| Knockout stage | Semi-finals | 1 December 2019 | 7 December 2019 | colspan="2" rowspan="2"| |- | Final | 22 December 2019 | 28 December 2019 |} Notes: == Group stage == The draw for the group stage was held on 8 September 2019 at the Hotel Sultan in Jakarta. The 10 teams are drawn into two groups of five. In each group, teams played a four-series home tournament with five matches for each series. The winners and runner-ups from each group advanced to semi- finals. === Group A === === Group B === == Knockout stage == === Bracket === === Semi-finals === Persib Putri won 2–0 on aggregate. \---- PSSI Disciplinary Committee awarded a 3–0 win to TIRA-Persikabo Kartini because Galanita Persipura refused to continue the match. TIRA-Persikabo Kartini won 7–5 on aggregate. === Finals === Persib Putri won 6–1 on aggregate. ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Player ! Team ! Goals |- | 1 | align="left"| Insyafadya Salsabilla | align="left"| TIRA-Persikabo Kartini | 14 |- | 2 | align="left"| Rulin Aspalek | align="left"| Galanita Persipura | 13 |- | 3 | align="left"| Febriana Kusumaningrum | align="left"| Persib Putri | 12 |- | rowspan="2"| 4 | align="left"| Sheva Imut Furyzcha | align="left"| Arema Putri | rowspan="2"| 10 |- | align="left"| Baiq Amiatun Shalihah | align="left"| TIRA-Persikabo Kartini |- | 6 | align="left"| Barbalina Salampessy | align="left"| Galanita Persipura | 9 |- | 7 | align="left"| Siti Latipah Nurul Inayah | align="left"| Persib Putri | 8 |} ==Awards== * Fair Play Team: TIRA-Persikabo Kartini * Best Young Player: Helsya Maeisyaroh (TIRA-Persikabo Kartini) * Best Player: Reva Oktaviani (Persib Putri) ==References== Indonesia 2019 Category:2019 in Indonesian football leagues
title: 2019 Liga 1 Putri
